page.title: 04MRS.WESTERN'S LIFE.
page.content: {Mrs. Western}is 69 years old with white hair, blue eyes, pierced ears and bright cheeks. Her first{job}was at the {newsagents}earning 5 shillings a week. She went to{school in 1920}in a dull blue or black dress and a clean white smock. Edna wrote on a slate, if she was bad she wrote a 100 lines. She lived in{Windsor Terrace which is now{Liddymore Road. She left school in{1929}after 9 years. Edna didn't have then any electricity and therefore no record players, washing machines, cars were too expensive. Water came from a tap in the kitchen. There was no bathroom so she bathed in front of the fire in a tin tub. For{games}she played snakes and ladders or drew. By Joanna Reed and Angeline Norton
